str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From Kaisar; Caesaria, the name of two places in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I entertain a stranger, (b) I startle, bewilder. From xenos; to be a host; by implication, be strange.
A Cypriote, belonging to Cyprus. From Kupros; a Cyprian, i.e. Inhabitant of Cyprus.
Original, primitive, ancient. From arche; original or primeval.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
